intro: Rudgea hostmanniana subsp. maypurensis, commonly known as the Maypurensis rudgea, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
